description.raw:
This pull request updates `dependencies.sh` for gazebo 6.

I tried to install the dependencies of gazebo 6 according to the instruction in the [tutorial page](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&ver=default&cat=install) but got an following error.
```
js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh
js@js:~$ sudo apt-get install $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $GAZEBO_BASE_DEPENDENCIES) $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES)
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package libsdformat2-dev
```

I could resolve this error by specifying `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION` as:
```
js@js:~$ ROS_DISTRO=dummy GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION=6 . /tmp/dependencies.sh
```

However, I think it would make more sense if `dependencies.sh` installs the dependencies of gazebo 6 by default when the major version is not specified since the gazebo version in the default branch is 6.

If the default version is set to 5 on purpose, then it would be good to comment that `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION` should be specified for gazebo 6 build in the tutorial.

title: Update dependencies_archive.sh for gazebo 6
